Text: TTPT Contingency Plan Required Testing Cc PST The attachment outlines the required testing of the Contingency Plan as requested by RMS and developed by the Texas Test Plan Team Testing is mandatory for all TDSPs except for Entergy A mandatory kickoff call will be held on January at pm Dial in and pass code number will be provided by Glen Wingerd Testing begins January and concludes no later than January with Production implementation on January Regards Shirley Whyte

Fw Workshop Feb thsmith PST Attached is a consolidated document that details specific issues the market is experiencing with the payment and remittance advice process The RMS meeting referenced below in Debbie McKeevers email will focus on this document and we will work to gain market consensus on resolution Please prepare by reviewing this document and bring a copy with you on the th Thank you Shirley Whyte Original Message From To Sent Friday February PM Subject Workshop Feb th Hello RMS has authorized an Workshop to focus Pilot and Retail Market Open issues regarding CR Payments and Remittance Advices to the TDSPs The workshop will be held in Austin atthe ERCOT Met Center Metro Center Drive on February th from am to pm The issues have been consolidated into a concise document that will be distributed by COB Monday Please be sure to read the document thoroughly prior to the meeting The suggested audience for this workshop is CRs and TDSPS ERCOT is not involved in the process It is highly recommended that CRs and TDSPs send a representative from their Treasury Department representatives from Accounts ReceivablePayable and a technical representative Please pass this meeting invitation on to those relevant in your organization The market is interested in resolving the existing issues quickly so please be prepared to send decision makers to this workshop Please RSVP to by COB on February th Thank you Debbie McKeever Issuesdoc

Re PUC Concerns with V CutoverPer Nancy Hetricks request attached is a spreadsheet that details Flight Frame Functionality Regards Shirley Whyte Testing Website Original Message From Hetrick Nancy Nancy NRONcom To Sent Saturday October AM Subject FW PUC Concerns with V Cutover These are the questions and concerns provided by Connie and Trish To Dos For consistency Dave Odle will you please address the first four items and provide the functionality difference for Version and as requested Please send this information ASAP to all three listserves Upon receipt of the above information each company should address from their perspective the questions posed in the second paragraph Each company TDSP CR ERCOT should then address from your companies perspective each of the questions regarding the various Options Shirley Whyte as ITPTA would you please provide to all three listserves ASAP an explanation of what funcitonality is tested in Frame so that companies may specially answer question Please evaluate the various options provided in the previous email and document from your companies perspective known or peceived risks any ideas on how to mitigate these risks what contingency plans do we need in place etc I wanted to get these items to you as soon as possible so you may begin to evaluateetc Since we have extremely tight timeframe for companies to gather this information and rather than forward all of this information to me to somehow combine By noon Tuesday October th please provide from your companies perspective TDSP CR and ERCOT for each option pros risks associated with each option any ways to mitigate these risks impacts to the marketcustomers and what would be the contingency plan Discussion around these items will also help us to answer the other questions posed but please come to the meeting prepared with your companies response to all of the questions I realize that this may not make sense on Monday morning since it is Saturday morning so please feel free to let me know if you have any questions etc Thanks Nancy A Hetrick Enron Corp Director Government Affairs Phone Pager Original Message From Corona Connie ENRON Sent Friday October AM To Hetrick Nancy Subject PUC Concerns with V Cutover Nancy We believe a good starting point for next weeks workshops as well as Staffs discussions with the Commissioners would be a chart that breaks out the following Functions that will not change from Texas SET v to v Functions that will experience minor changes from v to v Functions that will experience significant changes from v to v Functions that new to v Wed like to answer the following questions with respect to such a breakout Can we reasonably expect that functions in Categories and will function with the same degree of reliability in v as they currently do in v What are the risks associated with the failure of functions in Categories and What are the ramifications of those failures What workarounds are conceivable What workarounds are practical Additionally Staff has the following concerns and questions with the options presented thus far for cutting over to Texas SET Version None of the schedules thus far have allowed sufficient time for production testing Market participants have suggested that weeks is appropriate There is high probability based on problems encountered with v during the pilot of major problems with transactions Since nonchoosing customers will be migrated to the affiliate REP in January this coupled with the first concern above poses a significant risk This risk is most significant since the largest percentage of transferred customers is in the residential class There is no plan that clearly lays out riskstradeoffs if the migration doesnt work For example if the cutover fails would parties continue with If so what are the ramifications for full market open on and on market participants who have not tested on v Is market open as defined by participants tied absolutely to cutting over to v What happens if the market opens under v What functionality would be missing Are there easy workarounds for this missing functionality Is it a possibility that everyone cuts over to v on Dec the pilot caps are lifted for all customer classes but residential customers are still left with bundled rates nonPTB but not transferred until February What are the risks and ramifications for each market participant and each customer class if frame of testing has major problems that cannot be corrected for release in v by the timelines proposed Please contact us if you need any clarification
